website_summaries.verdict: Slightly bigger than most mini ITX cases, but compact enough to build a light but powerful gaming machine.
pros: Intake vent dust filter keeps interior cleaner
Cooling can be made a priority, with enough room for a full-size power supply and graphics card
cons: Cable management is difficult, and pushing in connectors can be tough in case’s tight spaces

customer_reviews.title: 7 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this case. For the cost, I feel there are better choices. The fans are all three-pin and are good, not great quality. The space behind the motherboard and the back removable panel is tight in my opinion. I was surprised at the weight of the case - it was light. No soundproofing material. Overall, a 7 out of 10 IMO. Corsair cut every corner they could for the almighty dollar. From the reviews I read, I expected more. I sent it back immediately and repurchased a Thermaltake case I used in an earlier build. Good luck to you and your purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Comfortably Numb

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed and low bar for Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed. I have the Corsair Obsidian 350D which is an amazing case. Unlike that one this is flimsy, quality control has dropped with pain chips, bent storage bay, and generally the layout isn't as perfectly designed as the other. The case is light but very easy to bend and didnt sit flat on a table, it would rock if you touched it. The front panel isnt as attractive with the visible case fans and the side panel glass is plastic and not symmetrical with the rest of the case. Its slightly offset. As a Corsair fan this is a disappointment. Avoid if you are looking for a 350D quality case.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality case, excellent air flow, large quiet fans (120mm rear fan is noticeably louder) and room for expandability. Only nit picky thing is sides are a little flexible which can make them tricky to put back on. Especially on the side with cables pushing against it. Also, the front screen is push to release, which I kept accidentally pushing when I was moving the case around. Both issues are very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case, it looks really nice. It has some great fans too, set up for positive air pressure out of the box. My only complaint is the dust filters. The dust filters on the top and in front of the intake fans are fairly large mesh, probably good for larger particulates, but not for normal sized dust particles. I ended up getting aftermarket filters from DEMCiflex for the top panel and intake fans. Maybe they made the large mesh to increase airflow.
customer_reviews.author: bassoongoon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: I built a newer rig recently, and this is the mid-toer version of what I did have (the 750D full tower). This is an awesome case with plenty of room and good cable management possibilities. The sucker is built well and the side panels are easy to remove. And the cooling is great on this. Corsair installs three quiet fans on this...I added two more. And it's a good looking case.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case because it had features from the earlie 2000's, but didn't know they didn't improve on them. First the side panel leaves no room for wires to hang so getting that side door to close after a full built system is impossible. Fron looks nice but can't close that back side unless you lay it on its side and had some major pressure. The front clip broke when taking off the grill, guess I didn't white glove it enough. All in All its a cheap case and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bartley

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Love the looks of this case. I have the 750d then the carbide seriess full tower but i wanted to downsize as i no longer need 5.25 dvd drives. The 450d is perfect. I had a hard time finding out if it fit the Corsair H115I PRO AIO cooler for my 9900k on top because it says it will fit the older version, but i can CONFIRM it fits the H115i with the exception of one less 5.25 bay (which i dont use). My temps dropped 10c from my full tower carbide case. Love this case even if it is showing its age!
customer_reviews.author: JohnPaul K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: Used this case for an i9-9900K build with a DVD-RW, so I needed something that looks as good as it performs in quietness and airflow. The cage for the internal 5 1/4" drive was essential for the DVD as well as an internal mounted 7 Port USB 3.0 hub. As the internal mounting mechanism is a slide-to-lock for DVD drives, I was able to add a tail on the right side to allow screws to mount it securely without compromising the case.
customer_reviews.author: Aparthenogenesis

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but dual slot gpu... maybe.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this case for years now! It's a great case for mid ATX form factor pc's. Noise levels varied on fans and over all set up. You can use water cooling radiators in it but it will begin to get space cramped in there. Dual cards can be used bit the lower one will need to be a single card size, dual sized gpu will barely fit on the bottom slot.
customer_reviews.author: Continus

customer_reviews.title: Corsair line unbeatable still.
customer_reviews.text: Careful which cooler if using a corsair water cooler. 115 pro required special screw driver to install. I ordered this sight unseen based on my ownerships experience with 650D case. 450 has exceeded expectations with location of fans/types and that the top and bottom have magnetic filters. Couldnt be more pleased with this case. Considered a lian case for this 570 amd build but glad i went back to solid steel tried and true Corsair midtower. Tons of room even with coolers and fans. Since all drives are ssd or m2. 2 ssd slots are on back of Mb mount if desired
customer_reviews.author: Hogwxld

customer_reviews.title: My favorite case!
customer_reviews.text: The 450D ATX case is still my favorite case. I've been using this case for over three years and I love the design and quality of the case. The design allows for high airflow and looks simple. The only thing I wish this case had would be a psu cover! Other than that it's a great case, and remains my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case, seems to be missing something though...
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough case - well designed and thought out. However, if you are not building a high performance rig, and therefore don't need the "optional" top 2x 120mm fans, be warned that there is no cover for the giant hole in the top of the case included. You will have to buy one from Corsair (Search obsidian 350D Dust cover on their site) or from 3rd party manufacturers. This seems like a "duh" moment for Corsair - the part is $3.99 to purchase, why not include it with a case that costs ~$100? Outside of that oversight, the case is solid. Plenty of room, good cable management, well designed conveniences that one would expect in a Corsair case.
customer_reviews.author: Dakine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful case, could not recommend it enough!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite case so far, I've owned and worked on many different computers but I really love this case, the side panels are very easy to take off and put back on, the brushed aluminum looks absolutely beautiful, the design was well thought out as well and it really shows! The back side also has an unexpectedly large amount of space for cable management and the built in feet make it that much easier to have good airflow along with the option for up to 5 120MM fans. This is an amazing case, and I would 100% recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Shut up and take my money! This case is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. I previously had a Zalman Mini-ITX case that was complete junk from the get go. I threw it away two months after getting it because it was already falling apart. Bought this case to replace it. This case is well constructed, sturdy, and extremely well designed. The amount of components you can fit into such a compact case and still have great airflow and temps are just amazing. I can't recommend this case enough if you want to do a small form factor gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best case I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best case I have ever owned. I love it. The only downside I can think of is that the drive bay covers are just covers and not doors, so if you put a drive in it looks really bad. But otherwise I absolutely love the design of the case. I did a lot of research on cases before settling on this one due to it's great airflow characteristics and its simple design; I don't like the really flashy cases a lot of manufacturers are selling these days. It has plenty of space inside and allows for clean cable routing through the back panel. I would highly recommend this case to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I have a corsair 350d for my micro build loved it so much that i am using a 250d ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a corsair 350d for my micro build loved it so much that i am using a 250d for a mini build I am doing. Love it. Corsairs build quality and design are top notch. Plenty of fan options are available for cooling. Side and top panels are removable allowing total access to the interior of the case. I did replace the stock fans with two Corsair AF 120 LED Quiet Editions and one 140 for the front. All and all great little case especially if you want to use the DVD/Blue ray bay. Nice touch not found in most small FF cases.
customer_reviews.author: Fred B.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this case to build a nice desktop NAS server for home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case to build a nice desktop NAS server for home. My desktop is inside the Corsair Obsidian 750D. These two cases sitting next to each other makes for one lovely desk! Clean look, modular build, and plenty of room for a 250mm radiator. Just make sure you look at a slim radiator or slim fans as the optical drive carriage can cause some clearance issues. I just BARELY cleared the carriage. Sleek, clean, resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Josh E.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but with a few problems.
customer_reviews.text: This case was perfect for my needs. It is running the h100 cooler with an air cooled GPU. It's a bit tough to put everything in there and upgrades can be a pain due to the small space but that's part of the mITX form factor (and this case definitely suffers from less issues than the even smaller cases in this form factor). My biggest complaint is that the fan filters no longer seem to stick to the magnets so I had to tape them down. You don't see it from the outside but it is still kinda tacky. I would use this case again.
customer_reviews.author: PunkRock

customer_reviews.title: Nice case: Functional, hold plenty of components, relatively easy to work with and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I have only built in Mini-Itx cases, and this one is terrific. The area for the cables rest can become a little bit of a rat's nest but you can get around that by some basic planning. The cable management doesn't have to look terrific but I did my best to keep the cables out of the way of the large front fan. Also, if you use a small form factor powers supply, like the ones from Silverstone you'll have some additional space in that nook to tuck in some cables. Of course, visual sins in cable management are not seen as the glass only allows a view of the motherboard area,
customer_reviews.author: MX-5 Miata Fan

customer_reviews.title: Over a nice, slick case for those who don't want something flashy.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love this tower. The window is a perfect size to see my rgb inside. My only issue is the room for wiring on the other panel. Some of my wiring, mainly for my power supply, is fairly thick and was a hard to get the side panel back on. In general the panels are a bit awkward to get back on, but I rarely open it up so that's not a huge issue overall.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I love this case. Quality construction. Fit/space may be an issue for some.
customer_reviews.text: I fit a Asus Maximus IX Apex board in here, though it is a little tight. The board partially covers the cable ports that help with cable management, but it's still usable. I also installed a corsair H110i water cooling system. It took some adjusting and will prevent me from using the top drive bay, but right now that is not an issue. I haven't tried installing a graphics card, but will update if i do.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues
customer_reviews.text: Case would be a good deal if it was half the price it is today. Inside is cheap and flimsy. Hard Drive cages are cheap plastic and very flexible. SSD trays on the back have a tool less design but again are cheap plastic and if you put an SSD into it without screws the SSD wobbles inside of it. Those cages are also cheap plastic. Case looks decent in person but the inside just felt cheap and not very well made. At this price I would avoid it. There are better quality cases out there for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME gaming case you'll have plenty of room!
customer_reviews.text: I have thought about getting this computer case for a long time, I always get the 750D Airflow but this case is one hell of a good case and has a lot more room in it than you would think. I had a Ryzen 7 with a Corsair H110i in the front push pull (x4 140mm Magnetic levitation fans) two 140mm fans in the top one 140mm fan on the bottom, 120mm fan in the back, Asus GTX 1080ti, optical drive, a 2 tb sata HD in the other slot and an HX850i Corsair Power supply. it still has plenty of room!
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: It may be not as elegant but it sure was better designed for cooling components in a small case
customer_reviews.text: Building one more Mini-ITX PC and this case is the most versatile I have ever seen. Very well designed and it's even a little smaller but more accommodating than the Bitfenix Colossus Mini-Itx I bought for another mini-ITX PC. It may be not as elegant but it sure was better designed for cooling components in a small case. Anyone thinking that wireless phones, tablets, and laptops are superior in speed and performance are kidding themselves. Don't listen to the hype. Besides, who needs to be online all the time that they need such small devices to actually do productive work? I pity the fools!
customer_reviews.author: The NO BS Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Solid case, not heavy, and isn't flimsy as I have read from one other review. Cable management is fantastic here, there is plenty of room to mount an H100i V2 or H110i and plenty of space for drives as well as SSDs if you plan to go the SATA route. There are brackets on the back to keep them completely hidden. I love the fans the unit came with and overall, this is a great bang for the buck. I've had it for a month now, the removable screens make it so easy to dust off.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed case.
customer_reviews.text: Do and online search of this case and you will see its populartiy. You can pack in some very powerful equipment in this small package. I have a fully water cooled GPU and CPU setup with plenty of HDD/SDD space and LED fans for cooling. This really is a great case for anyone wanting a mini-ITX single GPU unit. GPU - GTX 980ti Hybrid - fits easily CPU - i 4670k w/H100i pump and cooler Huge 200MM front fan - you can still run a DVD/BluRay drive
customer_reviews.author: Ceeg

customer_reviews.title: Superb minimalism!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the most easiest and smartest design for a mini ITX computer case available and it look simply awesome. Two 3.5" drive bays and two SSD drive bays, brilliant! Room for full size power supply? Genius! Compatible with most 240mm radiators at 27' and beyond thickness unless you have the ASUS Maximus VII Impact, almost perfect but genius non the less! The only thing missing on this case is a nice handle to carry it around with one hand but we can't be picky considering how functional and brilliant this case is, a removable motherboard tray would be a nice touch, perhaps in the future?
customer_reviews.author: KijinnoKamen

customer_reviews.title: Everything else is as expected coming from a premium case builder like Corsair. Super clean and professional with just the ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 starts if they had 4 USB ports in the front instead of 2. Everything else is as expected coming from a premium case builder like Corsair. Super clean and professional with just the right amount of flair. Personally I find a lot of the newer premium cases lately are just overkill in regards to design. They look like toys more than anything. May be cool if you're a tweenie but look silly under my office desk when you have guests over. This case is the perfect blend. Of course if you want a flashy gamer case with a sculpted shape and many LEDs, this isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: George I.

customer_reviews.title: Great case!  Well made, easy to work with, looks sharp
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, very easy to work with, and lightweight. Love that it has room in the top of the case for a 280mm radiator (I have the Corsair H110i GTX). Airflow is good and keeps temperatures low. I'm running an overclocked GTX 1080 and i7 6700k. This case provides enough airflow with the included fans to keep everything nice and cool. Love the brushed aluminum exterior, the dedicated SSD mounts on the back side of the case, and the nice, clean, transparent window on the side. Very clean, compact look - highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I expected more refinement  for  the money...
customer_reviews.text: The case is functional. Big fans. Removable drive cage. Magnetic filters. Pretty much as advertised. But the look and feel is kind of cheap. The metal is thin. It distorted when I lifted it by the lip of the box. The front grill/filter falls off pretty easily. The magnetic filters seem like after-thoughts. Will it do the job? yes. If is a beautiful case I can be proud of? no.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Case, Great Price, Tons of Features
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case, as far as looks go, this one really pulls off the simplistic look that I love so much. It has brushed aluminum plates on the front, and is full of small little features like removable hard drive bays, which are tool less by the way. It also has two dedicated bays for SSDs which is great. The cable management is pretty good for a case of this side, but I would still recommend buying a modular power supply. This thing is great if you're looking to build something a bit more low profile. Overall, its a great case and as long as you aren't looking for a ton of space, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! Notes: I installed a H100i GTX, and had to mount the radiator in reverse to allow the upper drive bay to be usable, and not have hoses interfere with the rear fan. Barely enough room. Also the front plastic is slightly hard to keep clean, I want real tempered glass! Also installed a stealth drive cover over the Blu-Ray drive to keep the nice look in front, there is a you-tube video on how to install it, velcro tabs work great!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: My new current favorite PC case
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore this case. Plenty of room for cable management, over-sized cpu coolers, long video graphic cards and lots of cooling fan positions. The tool less hard disk drive bays are lovely. Not in love with the behind the motherboard SDD mounting brackets that makes you run an extra power cable, but most people won't mind. My new system build went together really painlessly. Roomy on the inside, means large on the outside, so make sure you take that into account.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Y.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, the cold air gets in pretty well!
customer_reviews.text: A Better place for AMD Motherboard and components. Pros: - Great Airflow - Less silent - Cool dual 140mm Fans - Easy to clean magnetic filters and front vent - Good Cable management - The PSU gets a cold air at the bottom rather than getting warm air from the MoBo above. - and specially, the CPU cooler catches more air. cons: - nothing. Conclusion: This is a must-have case for gamers, because this one has it all! however, liquid cooling might be a best option for overclocking or casual gaming when it comes to a warm temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Loved this case
customer_reviews.text: Was first time building a computer. Loved this case. Plenty of room, great cable management. Built using an ATX motherboard. XFX R9 290 graphics card fit without an issue. SSD fits in a great mounting spot behind the motherboard. HD and DVD drive installed without any issues. High quality case. Feet keep the bottom off of the ground for good airflow. Front intake fan filter works great. Case has really good airflow. Been using for a few months now and I plan on using this case again for my next build and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brent H

customer_reviews.title: Great small case, fits many parts.
customer_reviews.text: This case works great. For a mini-ITX case, it gives you plenty of room to play around in, even if you don't have a modular power supply. It will fit most of your general components, including full sized graphics cards (I got a GTX 780 in there with no problem). The major con to watch out for is that you can't fit just any 240mm radiator in the case. I had originally purchased a Corsair H105, but it's too wide, and I had to return it and bought an H100i off a friend to use. As long as it is about as skinny as that radiator, it should fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Ristau

customer_reviews.title: Great if you don't mind getting creative with cable management
customer_reviews.text: I am coming from an Carbide 540, so this case is muuuch smaller. I picked this one up because It could still fit a full sized graphics card and power supply, but still retained a small form factor. It also helps I could keep using my h100i. Cable management is a bit tricky, but that could be because I've never built with a case this small before. It looks really nice though, and it does a good job of muffling noise. Every vent on this case has a magnetic filter to keep dust out, that is a huge plus to me.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: I like the simple design of this case and the ability ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the simple design of this case and the ability to put SSDs behind the motherboard. Probably what I'm liking the most is that, after 4+ months, there isn't dust caked on the water cooler's radiator under the fans, which is mounted to the top blowing outward; this tells me that the included air filters are doing a good job. The air filters can be simply removed and cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: cows

customer_reviews.title: Chinsey front fan cover clip broke in shipping or really bad Quality Control at the factory.
customer_reviews.text: Took the case out of the box and the left clip that holds the front fan cover was already broken. I might get another one and see if this was just a fluke with this one. But putting masking tape on the front of the case to hold this plastic cover on in shipping really does not give me confidence that those clips hold it on very well let alone last long, or it was broken already and they did that to be able to get the case in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, BUT!
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that I was expecting it to be a little smaller(my own fault for not looking closely at the dimensions) Size was it's about as tall as a standard atx case(I may try and remove the rubber feet, as they are tall. But overall the case is very very sturdy! lots of nice features, great airflow, SLI capable(no wonder it's so large?), Accepts large 240mm Radiators up top!, Easily cleanable fan filters. I have grown quite fond of this case to be honest, and I will adapt to it's large size in no time :) Highly recommended case.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyR

customer_reviews.title: Well built chassis for the mini-ITX form factor. Be ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built chassis for the mini-ITX form factor. Be extremely careful on your tolerances for add-in items. Add-ins that don't work: Corsair Hydro H100i v2 dual radiator cooling. 3mm too large - it juts into your motherboard tray. Cooler Master D92 processor cooling. Too tall. Verified add-ins that work: Corsair Hydro H60 single radiator. EVGA SuperNOVA 750 G2 Power Supply EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 FTW GAMING ACX 3.0 Video Card Asus Maximus VIII Impact Motherboard (Note the fan board mounts to the 5.25" tray)
customer_reviews.author: Neotech655

customer_reviews.title: This is the best mid-tower case I've ever done a build in
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mid-tower case I've ever done a build in. The cutout for the motherboard tray is huge but doesn't compromise the stability of the case. The grommeted holes for routing cables behind the motherboard tray are well placed and numerous. The 3 included fans are excellent and can blow super hard if you crank them way up. The only con that comes to mind is I wish there were a few more small holes near the bottom of the motherboard to route the front I/O cables.
customer_reviews.author: eisforawesome

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I love corsair my keyboard, ram, CPU cooler, and headphones are all made by Corsair and I don't know if I was not being careful enough but mine was was a bit faulty. The part in the front that hides the exhaust fans had clips keeping them attached to the case but, these things just fell apart the second or third time opening clipping the thing in and out. Also, the power button led at the front was broken and is always blinking. Other than those thing its an ok PC case.
customer_reviews.author: Stickbug

customer_reviews.title: looks great in almost every place
customer_reviews.text: This classic box was in my which list for a while, and was worthy the investment, looks great in almost every place, and is hard to forecast how much it can carry inside, keeps things cool and silent, on a really well engineered internal space, a good peace of hardware. I have p[planned several rolls for it in my home system arrays for the next years to come (IGW) which include, gaming PC, HTPC, and on the last part of it life cycle it will be our home server.
customer_reviews.author: South_DL

customer_reviews.title: Great case but putting a larger radiator in the top ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case but putting a larger radiator in the top is a tough thing to do even though they claim it can support a 360mm. The radiator would have to be INSANELY slim to fit the fans on it since the 5.25 drive bay metal part of the case is not removable and gets in the way. I do love the case though and would definitely recommend it, just not particularly for watercooling like my system.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Snowden

customer_reviews.title: ... the first case that came in was dented so bad that I couldn't close the door
customer_reviews.text: I'll first say that the first case that came in was dented so bad that I couldn't close the door, but luckily having Amazon, support helped me out an practically shipped me a new case and arrived the next day (really surprised there). Thumbs up to you Amazon! I like this case; I was going to pull for the 750D case from a local PC store in my area, but glas I didn't. This case is the perfect height and has all the bells n whistles I needed to build my new rig. I also have the H110 GTX which fits like a glove for this case and extra bays for storage expansion without taking up much space.
customer_reviews.author: QPang

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case. Good design. Stock fans are quiet. I may put in another side fan and one or two rear fans, but the case doesn't seem to need it at the moment. Cable routing is difficult, but that was expected and not a knock on the case. There are some tie downs. But for my audio wire to front jacks and front fan wire I ended up tying down to the fan grate on the back of the case. Overall, good looks, good construction, and relatively easy installation for a mITX form factor.
customer_reviews.author: J. & L. F.

customer_reviews.title: After a huge ordeal we finally got a good one. Don't buy warehouse deals
customer_reviews.text: After a huge ordeal we finally got a good one. Don't buy warehouse deals. It was a disaster. The one we got that was supposed to be like new was missing an entire side and pieces were broken off in the box. Ugh. Got a good one after the fact. Pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Blue0908

customer_reviews.title: Great came big but hopefully you do not get defective one cause it was so hard to remove the panel door
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Corsair Obsidian Series Black 450D would have gave it 5 stars but the side panel to the mother board came defective took me 1 hour or more just to force it open and mess with into getting the panel to open side ways anyways would been great if it did not came defective
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not what decribed!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo disappointed. I understand it was used but this is a project. *Missing fan *One broken fan *Broken front face plate clip(so it keeps falling off) *Hard drive case was completely unattached inside the case so it scratched the side glass *A BUNCH of the tooless screws are missing *Two PCI slot covers are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny lee

customer_reviews.title: great cool running case!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this for my new build because it is a Mid Tower that fits a full ATX and has extra room for upgrade and cable routing. The cable routing side kind of takes some work to get everything situated but it doesn't bulge out at all. The sata power cable to the HD cage is a snug fit. Plus this case can fit water cooling for future upgrades for me. Parts I have used that I've seen question of they fit in this case. MB: ASUS Maximus VII Hero Z97 PSU: EVGA Supernova 750G2 GPU: EVGA GeForce GTX970 SC CPU Cooler: Cooler Master Hyper Evo 212.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: An astounding "meh" for Corsair
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot of Corsair products and this case is one of the many recent products from them that is showing their lack of quality control and/or quality standards. I have had several parts break and the whole case just feels cheaply made. Corsair's tech support is dodgy at best, and not helpful in the slightest at worst. I would recommend this product only to someone on a budget, who doesn't mind rigging things themselves while waiting for replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Brand

customer_reviews.title: Great case. Love the side window and all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case. Love the side window and all the fans. Like the filter on the bottom. Real sleek modern look with the black brushed aluminum. Only issue is the tray to install harddrives. Couldn't figure out a way to install a SSD drive securely. It's only mounted with 1 screw at the moment. User error? I've built computers many times. The trays dimensions and screw hole locations are traditional for HDD.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Corsair 250D is a mini Itx water cooling beast!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this case If you want to build a gaming rig that doesn't engulf you're whole entire desk. I used a corsair H100i and a GTX690 which is a big gpu even by today's standards. Cable Managment is decent but just remember that the drive cage might not fit once your route everything like I did. I don't really use did players and there's enough to drive space so it didn't bother me. Definitely recommend this case if your going to do mini Itx.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewF.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space.
customer_reviews.text: This case is great, it still has plenty of space but is not oversized like the 450D. The build quality is great and it seems to keep dust away pretty well. It is not overly flashy like some other cases, it is nice and square and just looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Best Mini-ITX Case for the money. Easy to work on.
customer_reviews.text: After two years of owning this case, I still love it. I've had to replace the motherboard three times and swapped out the PSU once to troubleshoot. I love the amount of thumbscrews the case uses and how easily everything comes apart. The only thing I recommend is getting an external case speaker since there isn't one built into the case.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Damn
customer_reviews.text: So pretty. And just to clarify, because I wanted to mount two fans in the bottom and could not find an accurate measurement for psu length, it handles about 160mm. Much longer likely wouldn't fit. And you'd have to go a bit smaller if you wanted a radiator in the bottom. I has a few more millimeters to go before I couldn't mount my psu. FYI, it is the corsair cx750m. System isn't done yet, but building in it so far has been a dream considering this is my first time.
customer_reviews.author: obscureaudio

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini ITX Case!
customer_reviews.text: This case was replacing a BitFenix Prodigy case. Everything fit perfectly and the case runs a lot quieter than my old case. Also the front opens for some extra airflow if you need it for gaming or the like. It was really easy to assemble and no master-wiremanship required. I also put this up on my desk (because it is small) instead of under or in a cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: This case was a pleasure to work with. It's roomy, well built, and looks nice to boot. I did replace the included fans with higher quality fans, but if I'm totally honest it was because I wanted purple LEDs in the fans. I installed a radiator with no issues. All of the built-ins (USB, etc) work as expected. Next time I need a case, I'll be looking at this again.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: This case, for it being a midsized case, ...
customer_reviews.text: This case, for it being a midsized case, has trememdous airflow. I was able to piece together a marvelous build using the standard variety of parts, i.e an ATX board, gtx 770, etc... all of which fit without issue. The one shortcoming though is that this case has no fan power splitters, which mean that if you want to run a radiator up top, you would either have to buy a splitter separately or buy a motherboard that supports the extra fan headers. Otherwise this case provides a very mature and clean silhouette to my build.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Lots o' room for such a small case!
customer_reviews.text: Great mini-itx case. With my ham-hands, it gets increasingly difficult to put anything together that isn't a Corsair carbide! However, this alleviated many of my fears. I even have a Corsair H100i in there! This case is the best mini-itx I could find!
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: I found it to be extremely easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I only buy a new case for a computer every few years and this was the last case I have purchased (now over 2 years ago I think). I found it to be extremely easy to use, easier to access components than any other case I have worked with. Are there others better now? Maybe, but I haven't found any issues with this one so far.
customer_reviews.author: erik brandsberg

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but not perfect case
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather well-designed, very functional computer case. The 450D can accommodate nearly any ATX setup you can think of, with plenty of space, fan mounts, radiator mounts, 5.25" bays, 3.5" bays and 2.5" bays. The case is not loud, but when it's loaded with 4 or 5 case fans, it could be quieter. I'd prefer if they had designed the front mesh panel as a solid piece with intakes on the side to reduce noise and dust. Overall a very good case.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Tsay

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful design
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Corsair PC case product I can't say enough about them, thoughtful design and ease-of-use.
customer_reviews.author: Berto

customer_reviews.title: Its so beautiful!!!
customer_reviews.text: The case is beautiful, has excellent cable management options, and is a fairly easy case to build in. I ran into some space issues at the top left corner when putting in my mobo and connecting my 8 pin, but I attribute that to having large hands. The fans that come with the case are quiet(not Noctua quiet) enough that with it sitting next to me I hear my stock CPU cooler over all 3 of the case fans. I also found out that a traditional 8 pin connector is not quite long enough for the cable management runs and you may want to look at an extension if you get a CX series PSU with this case.
customer_reviews.author: WillisaurasRex

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Mid-Tower Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is very well constructed. Both side plates remove to give access to all channels for wires. 2.5" mounting points on the back if not using M.2. Included fans are high quality and very quiet. Windowed panel shipped with film to protect window from scuffs.
customer_reviews.author: AUlm27

customer_reviews.title: You can tell they really thought out the layout of everything with this case.
customer_reviews.text: I have been building computers for about 20 years now, and there is always at least one annoying thing with every case that makes you think "why would they do this" here is your exception. This case is very well made and the layout is well thought out. There are several features I like about this case; the snap in filters, hard drive cages, cable management, and airflow are among the top. You get a lot of case for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case
customer_reviews.text: Even though I measured the footprint before ordering, it was a bit larger than anticipated. I also ordered a Cooler Master Elite 130 for another build so I had them side by side when assembling which may have contributed to that impression. The case itself is still very small. The quality and build of the case is fantastic and I couldn't be happier with it. I love having the motherboard tray on the top. All of the panels are well constructed and the case feels very solid despite its ease of disassembly and overall light weight. The case is SILENT with stock fans and a stock Intel CPU heatsink even with my Asus GTX770 inside.
customer_reviews.author: jcoo1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tower!
customer_reviews.text: I wish Corsair would continue to make this tower. It was my most favorite tower to build in.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Philter

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! It's a great size and looks sleek. It fits all of my components with plenty of wiggle room to manage cables and look crisp on the inside. I only wish they included the air filter for the top of the case, I had to buy and after market one. The tool free design is pretty nice, it makes installing the drives real easy. All in all, I would definitely recommend this case to others.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Zak

customer_reviews.title: Good case for a budget build
customer_reviews.text: The only part of my build that I got open box and that didn't fail. fits a 240 cosair cooler tooless ssd hdd cages were cool. lots of config options.
customer_reviews.author: Dacartnb

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a streaming PC and decided to go with it since I use it's big brother thefor my main gaming machine. Same high quality and just the right amount of space for great airflow. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Neff

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Case
customer_reviews.text: The case is fantastic, it's very easy to build in. In terms of looks it's unassuming which is what I was going for. I one of the front usb ports was broken upon arrival. Corsair support promptly offered to send me a replacement part so it wasn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent micro ATX case
customer_reviews.text: Excellent micro ATX case. Well built, quality materials, and just generally looks amazing. It fit a full water cooling system for my CPU and had room to spare for a GTX 1080, two hard drives and an SSD. Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I was really pleased with this case
customer_reviews.text: Awsome case, this this thing can hold a lot of stuff in it for a Mini ITX Case. I had to trim my Noctua 200mm fan to fit in the front, which prevented me from being able to use the optical drive bay. The SSD/HDD bays could be a little smoother getting in and out. Other than that I was really pleased with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Helms

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't the easiest build ever, small cases are like that. In general though it wasn't bad. I've had this case about a year now and there is only 1 complaint... the power button isn't working as smoothly as it once did. Kind of have to push it in with force.
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Pete

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Clean
customer_reviews.text: I chose this case for the size and it is by far the best looking case I own. Does require a little bit more effort to hide the wires but that's because the case is not some ginormous tower that must be placed on the floor. I have an average size desk and it fits on top of the desk just fine. Combine this case with some nice liquid cooling system and LED lighting to make it look fancy. Perfect case for showing off your GTX 780 or 980
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: It fits full size gpu, psu, and most coolers with a optical drive simultaneously
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Well made, fits full size components including a Corsair branded 240mm aio with a optical drive, dust filters everywhere, has a single usb3 connector for2 ports and it looks nice. Con: cheap plastic hdd trays?, Metal feet would of been nice, reset button is a little to small for my liking
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D.

customer_reviews.title: Was not just minor cosmetic issues
customer_reviews.text: When ordering this I knew I was getting a product with some cosmetic issues. However, the "cosmetic issue" was a dent that prevents the installation of a fan or radiator at the top of the case. This product was damaged, not just some minor cosmetic issues. You can tell they tried to hide it too because they put the product in the case upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. 2 fans included one 140 AF and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. 2 fans included one 140 AF and one 120 SP. for Static Pressure and one for Air Flow A maximum of 5 total can be installed. I recommend maxim the case with all 5 fans going with the Corsair Air Series AF140 Quiet Edition and 120 SP Performance edition if you are overclocking. Be aware that the Corsair Hydro Series H100i Extreme Performance Liquid CPU cooling, is the biggest size water cooler you can install here.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: The bottom one comes out easy enough, but the top one requires you to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have one complaint about this case, and its the routing for the front fans. The bottom one comes out easy enough, but the top one requires you to disassemble the entire front of the case to get the connector through. I'm not sure if this is a unique problem to mine, but it could use some better fan cable routing. Still a very slick case with amazing airflow. My fans never have to rev up to keep my rig cool even under high load.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleek look of these cases. It's also extremely efficient when it comes to internal space and cable management. The rubber fittings on the various cable slots are also great. There's plenty of space, but not excessively. It's also very well ventilated and the magnetic dust filters on the top and bottom are a great addition. The only issue I have, which is a trivial inconvenience is that there aren't many tie down loops for zip ties, but other than that the cable management has been pretty solid for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: Cooler than cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case for the money! With the ventilation options this comes with and cable management its a hard one to beat. No excessive LED or obnoxious logos, it is a sleek looking case. And a huge plus, this case front and bottom intakes have magnetic air filters to keep inside nice and clean! As well as a magnetic filter on the top to prevent anything falling into your radiator or fans as they exhaust your case. There is one exhause on the back that doesn't have a filter but is not necessary. Keeps everything running cool. Great features for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Lots of thought went into the design. It's a well accommodating chassis.
customer_reviews.text: When this case was designed, a lot of thought went into how one might route cables, fan and radiator mounting, etc. Everything fits very well.
customer_reviews.author: N. Brown

customer_reviews.title: love the case
customer_reviews.text: love the case! However comes with 3 fans, so check your motherboard to see if you'll need an adaptor to run 3 fans. I ended up running just two fans because my motherboard only allowed 2. Case has a hidden area on the side where you can put a SSD without an adaptor kit.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini ITX gaming case!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board  to go into this case  wanting to reuse this cooler  I had from a previous build. It all fit in there, including the really long GPU I have  with one minor problem: the heat sink was a tad too tall for the top of the case. Fortunately, there was a removable plastic window right over the problem. I removed it, bought this  and made it work. Photo here:
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Bounds

customer_reviews.title: For a mid-tower this thing is pretty big. Glad I didn't spring for the 750 ...
customer_reviews.text: For a mid-tower this thing is pretty big. Glad I didn't spring for the 750 as space on my desk is at a premium. Plenty of room in this case and well optimized for cable organization and expansion.I particularly like how the standoffs come preinstalled.
customer_reviews.author: Beefcake

customer_reviews.title: The best mini-ITX case
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mini-ITX case. It is solid, very well made. Very well designed. Everything fits very well together. The drive cages are very easy to remove and install. Lots of venting and it came with two fans. Roomy enough for a full size GPU card and power supply and easily connect everything together. It looks great too. I like the window on the top where I can clearly see my Corsair CPU liquid cooler at work!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Nied

customer_reviews.title: Love the size and materials
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and materials. However, when I took off the front panel for the first time, part of the USB housing pealed up a bit. Just be careful when you remove the front of the case.
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case so far
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case so far. I would of preferred 1 or 2 more usb ports in front, but thats no reason not to buy. Construction felt great and sturdy. No issues with hardware and they leave a lot of areas for hiding cables which I like. Looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Elwinger

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Corsair Obsidian case. My first case was the 650d and I built a strong gaming computer using that case. I really liked the 650d, but it is a bit on the big side so I elected to go micro ATX and found an excellent Asus z87 motherboard and I'm on my way to another build. This case holds all I will need, a large cpu cooler & video card, 2 SSD drives and 2 hard drives. What more do you need? Also, it looks great. You cannot go wrong when you buy quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bone

customer_reviews.title: Great case - accepts 200mm fan - CPU cooler must be low profile
customer_reviews.text: Great case for the first time ITX builder. Plenty of cable stuffing room in the front. Will acceptwith full size optical drive installed. Aftermarket air CPU coolers must be low profile. No problems if you're using a stock cooler or water loop.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little Mini-ITX case.
customer_reviews.text: Great cable management and fits a full-sized ATX power supply. Power supply is mounted fan-down on the bottom, so probably wouldn't be recommended to place it on deep carpeting for long periods. Paired this with some SP120 fans and a H100i cooler block which fit perfectly. Amazing little case for the price. Having used the CM Elites before, this is a DEFINITE step up and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DCtheEE

customer_reviews.title: Little with a big heart!
customer_reviews.text: Have always liked this case from all the pictures and it lived up to it when I got it. Perfect size for my moms pc, surprisingly very spacious and can fit a standard GPU in it. The skylight window on the top is great for showing off internals. Easily one of the most fun cases I had to use in a build!
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case to build a new gaming PC. The case is quality, well built and well designed. The only issue I had was that I could not get my H100i V.2 radiator to fit inside the case but that's my fault for not researching correctly. Overall, great case
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great case, but shipping flaw.
customer_reviews.text: Side window came cracked. I knew it was damaged at purchase, but description stated damage was to bottom or back. Not the side window. Oh well. The price was right and a new window can be ordered for cheap. Case is great. Cable management isn't as nice as I thought. Case looks great, and was a huge upgrade from my old Cooler Master case.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Carroll

customer_reviews.title: good case for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome small compact case. Used it to build a mid range rig for my sister. Cable management is easy due to a wife open space between the front intake fan and where mobo sits. If you put a large gfx, it may be a different story. For the price, you won't regret it. One small confusion that I had was the power switch but if you are a builder you will figure it out. First time with corsair case and I am sold for this one.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: A very premium case you'll be glad you bought
customer_reviews.text: This is a premium product, made with very high quality materials, the fans are whisper quiet, and the power button just feels rich. I am very glad I spent the extra money to buy a case this nice. I was so impressed by it, I'd probably be willing to downgrade an internal part or 2 just to free up enough money to get this case.
customer_reviews.author: @myersbradley

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars/ hate to put that there but you see that big ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars/ hate to put that there but you see that big air vent on the front? the pieces that clip on broke so now i have to tape that big vent there to prevent the mouse and keyboard plug from hitting the fan. so in call the case is great but because problems like that can happen be aware. i would not turn my head from a case like this because it still does its job but breaking snapping pieces to hold the case is not a good look. need to improve on that
customer_reviews.author: SpaceFox

customer_reviews.title: Great cable management and airflow, side is indeed plexiglass
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this case for about a month now and am very pleased with it, cable routing is excellent, seems to ventilate well and preinstalled fans are silent and move a more than an acceptable amount of air. Would recommend to friends. Note: the side panel is completely see-through plexiglass as detailed in the description. When purchasing the picture had me second guessing myself.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson T

product_meta.title: CORSAIR OBSIDIAN 250D Mini-ATX Case
feature_bullets: Simultaneously fit two 3.5"/2.5" drives, two 2.5" drives, one 5.25" drive, a full sized PSU, a 290mm long GPU, and a 240mm radiator.
Front panel USB 3.0, headphone and mic ports, and power and reset buttons.
Innovative three panel removal for sides and top panel, with thumbscrews.
Tons of cable routing tie downs for easy cable maintenance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,126 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
